thread.title: Kent State at UMass
thread.title_full: Kent State at UMass | Boston Herald

author: John Connolly
title: Kent State at UMass
text:
3:30 p.m. — McGuirk Alumni Stadium, Amherst
E SPN3 — Radio: WATD 95.5-FM, WCRN 830-AM
THREE THINGS TO WATCH
1. Senior receiver Tajae Sharpe is rewriting the record book. Sharpe needs 33 yards to equal Adrian Zullo’s career receiving yardage mark of 2,892 set from 1998-2002. Already the program leader in career receptions with 224, Sharpe has caught at least one pass in all 40 games he has played, the third-longest active streak in Division 1.
2. The Minutemen must improve in red-zone defense. Opponents have scored on all 22 of their drives inside the UMass’ 20, with 15 of the 22 (68 percent) ending in a touchdown.
3. UMass needs to make better half-time adjustments. Foes have outscored the Minutemen, 71-14, in the third quarter of games this season.
